avdta.network

Class ImportFromVISTA

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.ImportFromVISTA

  • public class ImportFromVISTA
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines methods to convert network data from the VISTA data format to the AVDTA data format. This class uses the following tables from VISTA: nodes, link_details, phases, signals, and links. To use it, copy the required tables into files, and construct a new ImportFromVISTA with the files. The constructor will call all conversion methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ImportFromVISTA(Project project, java.io.File nodes, java.io.File linkdetails, java.io.File elevation, java.io.File phases, java.io.File signals, java.io.File linkpoints)
      Converts VISTA network data into the AVDTA data format from the following files.
      ImportFromVISTA(Project project, java.lang.String directory)
      Calls ImportFromVISTA(avdta.project.Project, java.io.File, java.io.File, java.io.File, java.io.File, java.io.File, java.io.File) with a nodes.txt file, a linkdetails.txt file, a elevation.txt file, a phases.txt file, a signals.txt file, and a links.txt file from the specified directory.

      • convertNodes

        public void convertNodes(Project project,
                         java.io.File nodes,
                         java.io.File elevation)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Converts the nodes table. Also adds elevation if the elevation file exists. If the elevation file is null, it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        project - the Project
        nodes - the file containing the database table
        elevation - the file containing elevation data. This file is optional.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file is not found

      • removeDuplicateCentroids

        public static void removeDuplicateCentroids(Project project,
                                            int origin_offset,
                                            int dest_offset)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method undoes the origin/destination centroid separation in VISTA. VISTA typically has centroids separated by origin and destination. For example, centroid 1 might be split into origin centroid 10001 and destination centroid 20001. Some functions in AVDTA need centroids to be combined. This method combines them, given that the origin and destination offsets are known. The files modified are nodes, links, static_od, and dynamic_od. Files are initially created in the results folder, then renamed appropriately.
        Parameters:
        origin_offset - the offset for origin centroids
        dest_offset - the offset for destination centroids
        project - the project
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed
